description: Students synthesize knowledge and apply evidence-based practice in the care and management of
patients with multiple complex health conditions.  The focus of this course is on caring for
limitations in their ability to function due to physical, mental, and psychosocial challenges.
Simulation is used to facilitate student learning in critical care environments.  Offered annually
in the spring semester.  Prerequisites: open to senior
nursing majors only; NURS 312 with grad of C or above, NURS 315 with grade of C or above, and NURS
316 with grade of C or above;
concurrent registration in NURS 317, NURS 318, and
